Description: Lapis lazuli fragment of amuletic figure in the form of a hawk-headed standing god Haroeris, wearing tripartite headdress, double crown and shendyt kilt, left hand at breast holding a sceptre, right arm by side, with a suspension ring projecting behind the head.
Curator's comments: Provenance not specified in the Museum register, but certainly from Tell Dafana, as suggested by the context of the item in the list, and indicated on the ancient wooden mounting; probably the lapis lazuli "Horus" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.45, p.61-62, p.180, pl.22)
Condition: fair (incomplete : feet and base broken away)
